results.title: Conformity, obedience and dissent
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Leslie Hill and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Scientific experiments have consistently revealed how difficult it is for the individual to dissent or disobey within Western society. This video examines the psychological and social phenomena of conformity, obedience and dissent, using interviews with prominent US psychologists and referring to landmark experiments on obedience such as that conducted by Stanley Milgram. In this experiment, two-thirds of subjects applied increasingly powerful electric shocks as punishment simply because an authority figure told them to do so.

results.title: Confessions of a Simple Surgeon
results.creator_credit: Paul Harmon and Educational Division of N S W Dept of TAFE
results.brief_description: This humorous presents the associated health risks of smoking and passive smoking in an often graphic but factual manner. “Confessions” calls for a total ban on tobacco promotion and its message to viewers is clear. If you smoke, quit. If you don’t , don’t be conned into smoking and avoid being a victim of passive smoking. It is presented by Dr Arthur Chesterfield-Evans, whose experience in surgery on cancer victims led him to become an activist in BUGAUP (Billboard Utilising Graffitists Against Unhealthy Promotions) and in the legal activities of the Non-Smokers Movement of Australia.

results.title: Conducting good music
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog, David W. Ridgway and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A brief outline of the history of conducting leads to a discussion of conducting as a sign language, which translates the composer’s signs and instructions on the score into signals which the orchestra can follow. How each conductor gives their own interpretation to a work is shown by contrasting performances of the same passage conducted by different artists. Features the Vienna Symphony Orchestra.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milan Herzog, David W. Ridgway and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Conditioned reflexes
results.creator_credit: Artkino Pictures, Brandon Films and Moscow Popular Science Film Studio
results.brief_description: Reviews some of the work of the Russian physiologist, Ivan Pavlov, whose experiments with conditioned reflexes paved the way to a better understanding of human and animal behaviour. The difference between blind instinct present in all animals from birth, and reflex reactions set up by conditioning to certain often repeated stimuli is made clear. The process of checking the reflexes is explained and its application in the treatment of certain neuroses in human beings is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Artkino Pictures, Brandon Films and Moscow Popular Science Film Studio

results.title: Concrete practice
results.brief_description: SUMMARY:The film examines formwork in building construction andiscusses the problems caused by pressure when concrete is placed etc. Handling and storage of formwork as well as the application of release agents are also demonstrated.

results.title: Concrete poetry
results.brief_description: Presents , against an interpretive visual and musical background, several works selected from an anthology of concrete poetry compiled by Emmett Williams, in order to demonstrate a new poetic form. The poets include: Ronaldo Azeredo, Carlo Belloli, Claus Bremer, Bob Cobbing, Ian Hamilton Finlay, Oecio pignatori, and Emmett Williams.

results.title: Concrete pipes and pre-stressed products
results.brief_description: The manufacture of reinforced concrete products at Hume’s plant in Victoria. Welding the reinforcing for a concrete pipe and casting the pipe; preparing the reinforcing for slabs, beams and piles; pouring concrete and settling it with a mechanical vibrator; curing the concrete; transporting the finished goods to the site.
